fixes.name: Index
fixes.solution_explanation: Tableau's INDEX() is a table-calculation (row position) which has no direct one-to-one DAX function. In Power BI you typically create a physical index column in Power Query or use RANKX with an explicit ordering expression. The measure above uses RANKX(ALLSELECTED('Sheet1 (radial_bar_chart_data)'), 0, , ASC, DENSE) as a placeholder to produce a row-based rank within the current filter context â€” replace the second argument (the 0) with the expression that defines your desired ordering if needed. The final result follows the original formula: (index - 1) * 2.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The Tableau formula uses the table calculation INDEX(), which is context/aggregation-based (row-position). Per conversion rules, table calculations must be converted to measures in Power BI.
